GDCRYST_BIOME_GemGardenAmethyst <color=#B967FF>gem garden</color> A gem pillered barren of geoluminescent crysto-quartz dusted with a powdering of soft sand dunes. \nPonds pool upon impermeable crystal basins and plant life fails to find purchase on a wind shifted surface. Despite the lack of vegetation the lingering water pools draw a niche array of desert animals. \nGem Gardens are popular tourist locations among glitterworld star-trekkers and tribal populations often became enamored with the immense beauty of the land, constructing sacred shines to crystal idols; likewise planetary elite will hew vast palatial complexs into crysto-quatz cliffs when locally available, or pay exorbitant prices to ship the materal in from afar. \n<color=#B967FF><size=16>Gameplay highlights:</size></color><size=12> \nSmooth gem dunes once to change to rough gemstone (light affordance), smooth again to obtain a smooth surface. \nLack of initial bulding surface mixed with little food/no plants make to hard to get established without an outside base of supply. \nConsider a bridge based lake base for emergency settlements. \nExperimental atm, non-basic biomes are trickey and take a ton of C#. My coding is a bit wonky but it works with Advanced/Alpha biomes. Pretty calculation intensive atm with all the glowers but playable, tiny lagspikes when you mine crystal or coverup glowing floors, will work to improve this this overtime.</size> Crystosentient.Biome.BiomeWorker_Gem
